        public DefaultThreadingModel(String threadNameBase,
                             int threadPoolSize,
                             int maxNumWaitingLimitedTasks)
        Create a DefaultDempsyExecutor with a fixed number of threads while setting the maximum number of limited tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • setCoresFactor

        public DefaultThreadingModel setCoresFactor(double m)

        Prior to calling start you can set the cores factor and additional cores. Ultimately the number of threads in the pool will be given by:

        num threads = m * num cores + b

        Where 'm' is set by setCoresFactor and 'b' is set by setAdditionalThreads

      • setAdditionalThreads

        public DefaultThreadingModel setAdditionalThreads(int additionalThreads)

        Prior to calling start you can set the cores factor and additional cores. Ultimately the number of threads in the pool will be given by:

        num threads = m * num cores + b

        Where 'm' is set by setCoresFactor and 'b' is set by setAdditionalThreads

      • setHardShutdown

        public DefaultThreadingModel setHardShutdown(boolean hardShutdown)
        When closing this ThreadingModel, use a hard shutdown (shutdownNow) on the executors.

      • setBlocking

        public DefaultThreadingModel setBlocking(boolean blocking)
        Blocking will cause ThreadingModel.submitLimited(net.dempsy.threading.ThreadingModel.Rejectable, boolean) to block if the queue is filled.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()

      • submit

        public <V> Future<V> submit(Callable<V> r)
        Description copied from interface: ThreadingModel
        Submit a Callable that is guaranteed to execute. Unlike submitLimted this method acts like the Callable was added to an unbounded queue and so should eventually execute.
        Specified by:
        submit in interface ThreadingModel

      • submitLimited

        public <V> Future<V> submitLimited(ThreadingModel.Rejectable<V> r,
                                   boolean count)
        Description copied from interface: ThreadingModel
        This method queues Callables that can expire or have some maximum number allowed. Normal message processing falls into this category since 'shedding' is the standard behavior. If counting is true then the ThreadingModel should queue it without counting it against the maximum capacity.
        Specified by:
        submitLimited in interface ThreadingModel

      • schedule

        public <V> Future<V> schedule(Callable<V> r,
                              long delay,
                              TimeUnit unit)
        Description copied from interface: ThreadingModel
        Schedule a task to be executed at some time in the future.
        Specified by:
        schedule in interface ThreadingModel
